news.title: Updated AATS Guidelines for Managing Leaky Heart Valve
news.summary: It has always been difficult to treat ischemic mitral regurgitation (IMR) due to its complexity in patients, difficulty in grading IMR, the variety of medical and surgical options, and lack of long-term quality studies.

news.title: Updated AATS Guidelines Help Cardiovascular Surgeons Navigate the Challenges of Managing Ischemic Mitral Regurgitation
news.summary: - Mitral regurgitation can occur in up to 50% of patients with ischemic heart disease and even mild ischemic mitral regurgitation (IMR) has been linked to increased long-term mortality.

news.title: AATS provides updated guidelines for managing ischemic mitral regurgitation
news.summary: The American Association for Thoracic Surgery (AATS) released updated evidence-based guidelines for managing ischemic mitral regurgitation.

news.title: Updated AATS guidelines help cardiovascular surgeons navigate the challenges of managing ischemic mitral regurgitation
news.summary: Beverly, MA, April 17, 2017 - Mitral regurgitation can occur in up to 50% of patients with ischemic heart disease and even mild ischemic mitral regurgitation (IMR) has been linked to increased long-term mortality.
